content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here is the function to clean column names:

```julia
function clean_column(col::AbstractString)
    col = strip(lowercase(col))
    col = replace(col, r"\s|-" => "_")
    return col
end
```

To explain:

- `lowercase(col)` converts the column name to all lowercase letters
- `strip(col)` removes any leading or trailing whitespace  
- `replace(col, r"\s|-" => "_")` replaces any spaces or hyphens with underscores

So this standardizes column names to be lowercase with underscores instead of spaces/hyphens.

Some examples:

```julia
clean_column("My Column") # "my_column" 

clean_column("my-column") # "my_column"

clean_column("  ID Number   ") # "id_number"
```

Let me know if you need any clarification or have additional requirements!
